disease: Malignant neoplasm of bone and articular cartilage, unspecified

symptoms.name: Bone pain
symptoms.pattern: Can range from mild to severe; may be localized or widespread

symptoms.name: Pathological fracture
symptoms.pattern: Fracture due to weakened bone from the tumor

symptoms.name: Weakness
symptoms.pattern: General feeling of weakness or fatigue

symptoms.name: Unspecified symptoms
symptoms.pattern: May be asymptomatic in early stages

imaging_findings.X-ray: May show lytic lesions, sclerotic lesions, or pathological fractures
imaging_findings.CT scan: Provides detailed images of bone structure and can help to assess the extent of the tumor
imaging_findings.MRI: Can help to differentiate between tumor and surrounding tissues
imaging_findings.Bone scan: Can detect areas of increased bone turnover associated with the tumor

required: Imaging findings consistent with malignant bone or articular cartilage neoplasm
supportive: Clinical symptoms and physical examination findings
